intro: Camellia septempetala, commonly known as the seven-petaled camellia, is a species native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its striking, double-flowered blooms that typically appear in late winter to early spring. The plant produces elliptical, dark green leaves that are glossy and arranged alternately along the stems. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and requires partial shade to full sun. Camellia septempetala is valued both for its ornamental beauty and its historical significance in traditional Chinese horticulture.
